required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 10, 2017
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Evaluate Efficacy of New Paracetamol Formulation Compared to Ibuprofen in Headache
clinical_study.official_title: A Study to Assess Efficacy Over Placebo and Speed of Onset of Pain Relief of New Paracetamol and Caffeine Tablets as Compared to Ibuprofen in Episodic Tension Type Headache

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this multi-center study is to assess the efficacy of headache relief of new paracetamol/caffeine formulation compared to placebo and ibuprofen in episodic tension-type headache (ETTH).

primary_outcome.measure: Sum of Pain Intensity Difference (SPID) of Treatment and Placebo
primary_outcome.description: SPID was calculated as the weighted sum of pain intensity differences at 4 hours post dose. Pain intensity at each time point was calculated as difference of pain intensity at baseline with pain intensity at a given time point. n=number of participants analyzed in respective treatment arm for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Sum of Pain Intensity Difference (SPID) of Other Treatments
secondary_outcome.description: SPID at each time point was calculated as weighted sum of pain intensity differences at baseline with pain intensity at a given time point. n= number of participants analyzed in respective treatment arm for this outcome measure varies over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Perceptible Pain Relief

secondary_outcome.description: Time to perceptible headache relief was assessed as the time when participants achieve pain relief scores (PRS) more than or equal to 1.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Meaningful Pain Relief

secondary_outcome.description: Time to meaningful headache relief was assessed as time when participants reported a PRS â‰¥ 2.

TOTPAR was calculated as the weighted sum of pain relief scores of PRS at each time point with time interval between any two time points being used. n= number of participants analyzed in respective treatment arm for this outcome measure varies over time.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Time-Response Curve for Change in Headache Intensity and Headache Relief (SPRID)
secondary_outcome.description: SPRID was measured as sum of TOTPAR and SPID.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global Evaluation of Response to Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Global evaluation of treatment response was measured by a score in a scale from: 0-very poor, 1-poor, 2-neutral [neither poor nor good], 3-good, or 4-very good).
Proportion of participants that took rescue medication over the total number of participants for a given treatment group.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Headache Pain Intensity
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in headache pain intensity was calculated as the change (difference) from baseline pain intensity with pain intensity at each time-point.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 10 min. 15 min., 20 min., 25 min., 30 min., 40 min., 50 min., 60 min., 90 min., 120 min., 180 min., 240 min.,
secondary_outcome.description: Headache Relief was measured as PRS over the time.
Number of participants with complete relief was calculated as the ratio of number of participants that reported PRS = 4 over the total number of participants for a given treatment group.

arm_group.description: Two caplets of paracetamol/caffeine combination plus 2 placebo caplets to be administered
Two ibuprofen caplets plus two placebo caplets to be administered
Four placebo caplets to be administered

intervention.description: Caplets containing 500 milligrams (mg) of paracetamol and 65 mg of caffeine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants in good general health, and with diagnosis of ETTH with following conditions:
1. number of days with the condition is historically greater than or equal to two per month;
2. severity of headaches is historically at least moderate;
3. duration of headaches is historically more than or equal to 4 hours, if untreated.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant with known or suspected hypersensitivity, allergy, intolerance or contraindication to the use of any of the study medications
- Participant has chronic tension type headache, psychiatric disease or a significant cognitive disorder, or any chronic pain disorder.
- Participant currently taking or has taken medications or herbal supplements within the three months that are likely to interfere with the validity of subject-rated assessments.
